wikipedia_page.main: Eva Elwes (born  Gertrude Emma Cannon; 1876–1950) was an English actress and playwright who wrote over 50 plays between 1907 and 1938.

response: * In 1925 Eva Elwes wrote a play Edith Cavell, Nurse and Martyr. It was refused a licence by the Lord Chamberlain after consultation with Cavell's sisters. After changes to the title and characters the play was granted a licence as The Price She Paid and performed in 1927.
*Eva Elwes (1876–1950), actor, playwright and manager of Alexandra Theatre, South Shields

thumb|upright|right|Dolly Peel statue in South Shields, facing the River Tyne. In 1923 South Shields playwright Eva Elwes wrote Dolly Peel, a play based on her life. It was revived by the Customs House theatre in 2005.
